definition: lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to swell/swelling/swollen
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]

fat/plump
healthy/at ease
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: If you get beyond your depth like this , it is you who will suffer at last.
sentences.chinese: 你這樣打腫臉充胖子，到最後只能自己喫虧。

sentences.english: If you get beyond your depth, you' ll suffer.
sentences.chinese: 打腫臉充胖子，喫虧是自己。

sentences.english: He always did like this to pretend to be a wealthy man.
sentences.chinese: 他這個人總是喜歡打腫臉充胖子。

sentences.english: Many maintain that Britain should give up the pretence of being a busy power.
sentences.chinese: 許多人認爲，英國該停止打腫臉充胖子，故作繁忙了。

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
Every family goes through its problems. (idiom)
pinyin: jia1 jia1 you3 ben3 nan2 nian4 de5 jing1

definition: foolish talk/nonsense
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: vain
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
wealthy son-in-law/wealthy husband
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
(not) a single person/(no) one
trivial matter/a piece of cake
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
